document_data.name: Jahaboam
document_data.mainbody:
'''Jahaboam''' was a merchant of trinkets and far-flung wares from the City of Coin, [[Athkatla]], in [[Amn]] in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
{{quote|''Just say the word, and all manner of wonder is at your disposal. Eh, and don't overlook the mundane. [[Bread]] and [[butter]] sales, they are.''|Jahaboam}}
document_data.Description: Jahaboam was a large man with pale skin.
document_data.History: Jahaboam's street stall could be found by Athkatla's docks in the [[Athkatla/Wave District|Wave District]] in the {{YearlinkName|1369}}. At that time, Jahaboam's stock consisted of souvenirs and trinkets as well as some simple [[weapon]]s and [[armor]]. The selection also included several more common [[potion]]s and a certain [[enchanted]] keepsake locket, favored by [[Jaheira]], a companion of [[Abdel Adrian]].
